 Onboard 
interactions  In August 2008, American Airlines became the first U.S. airline to offer in-flight internet access. By the 
end of 2009, Gogo, our in-flight inte rnet service, was installed on all of our 767-200s and 150 of our 
MD-80s. In 2010, we continued instal ling the service on our entire 737 fleet. 
Cabin interior 
condition  We have instituted world-class cabin cleaning systems via  
• Staff training  
• Identification and standardization  of cleaning tools and products, with color-coded bags of 
cleaning supplies specific to each area of the aircraft  
Baggage handling  We are working with gateway cities to provide better baggage sortation procedures and faster delivery 
of bags being transferred from other airlines to American. 
We revised procedures for loading and unloading bags in certain European cities and introduced bag 
tags in various languages to improve bagga ge tracking and the post-flight experience. 
Baggage tracking 
and resolution  T-Link is a mini-computer device installed on tugs to help reduce baggage misconnects by providing 
real-time gate information and efficient route informati on to fleet service clerks delivering connecting 
bags.
